model

Class UserDataManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.UserDataManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class UserDataManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    User Data manager is a container for the employee data, including first and last name, usernames, passwords User data is stored in an array list with index 0 being an admin by default
    Author:
    Chris DeMonte, Matt Guidi
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserDataManager()
      This no parameter constructor creates a new user list

    • Method Detail

      • addUser

        public void addUser(java.lang.String firstName,
                    java.lang.String lastName,
                    java.lang.String password)
        Adds a user with a given firstname, lastname and password
        Parameters:
        firstName - is the first name of the employee
        lastName - is the last name
        password - password is a password with 8-16 characters, at least one number, at least one lowercase letter, at least one uppercase

      • getUser

        public UserData getUser(int index)
        Gets the user using an index
        Parameters:
        index - is the user's index in the array
        Returns:
        a userData object

      • getUser

        public UserData getUser(java.lang.String userName)
        Gets the user using a String for username
        Parameters:
        userName - is a String using the first letter of the first name, last name, and index number
        Returns:
        returns the userData object

      • validPassword

        public boolean validPassword(java.lang.String password)
        Checks if a password is valid (8-16 characters, at least one uppercase letter, at least one lowercase, at least one number)
        Parameters:
        password - is the string representing a possible password
        Returns:
        true if the password is good, and false if it fails to comply to the requirements

      • passwordCheck

        public boolean passwordCheck(java.lang.String userName,
                             java.lang.String password)
        Checks a username-password pair, by comparing the two inputs to the data saved in the usermanager
        Parameters:
        userName - is the input username
        password - is the input password
        Returns:
        true if the password matches the records, else returns false

      • getIndexFromUserName

        public int getIndexFromUserName(java.lang.String userName)
        This takes in a username and filters out any non numeric characters to give a number representing the user's index in the user array
        Parameters:
        userName - is the user's username
        Returns:
        the numerics in the username that are utilized by the userManager as array indexes

      • login

        public UserData login(java.lang.String userName,
                      java.lang.String password)
        Logs a user in by taking in their credentials and returning the user data object
        Parameters:
        userName - is the user's username
        password - is the user's password
        Returns:
        the user's userData if credentials are good, else returns null
